root: ^Don't worry, I know the rules. You were here first and the bed is yours. You know, I never ask for anything, but can I sit here? It's been a long and tiring journey.

s: ^You may sit down. But do not forget you're sleeping on the floor tonight.
^Of course. Sit down here, it's hard to stand in such a crowded cell.

c-1: ^Rules are rules. Although I really doubt anyone will be able to catch any sleep in such a packed cell.
c-2: ^Your heart is soft. Don't worry, it won't stay that way for too long.
g-0: ^Here we are. Just think about it! 45 days on a train, 2 days on a boat.
^I've been to this part of Russia before, but never could I imagine I'd have to travel all the way to Magadan again.

s: ^I know you. You were a member of the Socialist Revolutionary Party.
^Former terrorist? I thought you left the country.
^I heard you were a spy. I am sure it was another lie.

c-1: ^I did. But they lured me into a trap. I have no regrets though, I'd rather die here than in France, like one of those impotent immigrants.
c-2: ^It sure was. They need those spy cases for the Purge to happen.
g-0: ^It is quite ironic. I was arrested for anti-goverment activity in 1907 and I am an enemy of the Soviet state today. Tings did not change for me that much.
^All those sentimental idiots say that our Revolutionw as a dream that never came true.
^The Revolution was first and foremost an opportunity. We had our chance and we missed it. What is your name?

c-0: ^If you don't mind me asking, was General Kojukh your father?

s: ^No, I do not have a father.
^He was. He was arrested for no reason.

c-0: ^His trial was a total joke, and you could tell how badly those miserable party clerks wanted to get rid of him.

g-0: ^I am sorry. Let me give you some advice. Forget about your former self. Focus on more important matters.
^You are a prisoner now. Remember, time is your main enemy. You can trust me on this one, I know what I am talking about.
^Let's play a simple game. It's called Numbers. It is very popular around here so you better remember the rules. It might even save your life one day so listen carefully.
